title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 06 April 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:11 <jssolichin> has joined #xwiki  
00:12 <jssolichin> I have a question for the XWiki GSOC app. It says "Please provide one or more URLs to code samples that you have written in the past or to XWiki jira issues for which you have provided a fix in the form of a pull request" and I was wondering whether the "fix in the form of a pull request" applies to all code. I have written code, but not for the XWiki jira  
00:14 <rrodriguez> has quit  
00:16 <fmancinelli> has quit  
00:19 <@sdumitriu> Hi jssolichin  
00:19 <@sdumitriu> Yes, any pull request is valid  
00:20 <polx> has quit  
00:33 <jssolichin> Ok so that section is mostly concerned with our capability to pull codes from eg. github, and not our coding ability--so we shouldn't just link codes we've written, but rather those written as forks. Great thanks Sdumitriu!  
00:33 <@sdumitriu> You're welcome jssolichin  
00:38 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
00:38 <DrLou> has quit  
01:02 <jssolichin> Sorry, another question. The app asks whether I 'would be willing and able to do other projects instead.' Since I am interested in XWiki mobile dev, will listing this interest in one app (for responsive design) suffice, or should I also submit a different application for the mobile dev.  
01:03 <@sdumitriu> jssolichin: What project are you applying for in the first place?  
01:04 <jssolichin> sdumitriu: the responsive web design based on foundation.  
01:04 <jvdrean> has quit  
01:04 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
01:05 <@sdumitriu> It should suffice, but if you have the time to write another application, you should do so  
01:18 <jssolichin> Sdumitriu: If i am able to completely flesh out more ideas for the mobile dashboard, would it be ok to append it to the same application, since only the project aspect of the application will be different (I am after all one man) or should I submit a completely different one.  
05:23 <jvdrean> has quit  
07:30 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:40 <jssolichin> I wanted to confirm: XWiki's skin only applies to the front end yes?  
08:07 <vmassol> jssolichin: hi, wdym by front end?  
08:14 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:29 <jssolichin> vmassol: it doesn't effect the administration right? only what the public sees?  
08:31 <vmassol> jssolichin: it affects all view  
08:31 <vmassol> \*views  
08:31 <vmassol> view, edit, admin, etc  
08:32 <vmassol> or rather it can affect anyhing, depends what the skin implements :)  
08:33 <jssolichin> but it uses the same structure of actionbar/content area/panel/tabs? i guess my true question is, the administration section is not handled separately?  
08:33 <vmassol> xwiki has tons of different views, we call them vm files  
08:34 <vmassol> or actions  
08:34 <vmassol> edit, history, attahcments, delete, admin, etc  
08:34 <vmassol> a skin modifies those vm files  
08:34 <vmassol> see  
08:35 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Skins  
08:37 <jssolichin> ah ok i see, sorry I was going off: http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GettingStarted/XWikiEnterpriseBasicConcepts and the colibri skin pageto figure out the layout of the xwiki skin  
08:41 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:42 <jssolichin> Ok, i see how the skin process works. So I guess it is based more on modules than on "page views" Thanks for the link!  
08:42 <vmassol> np  
08:58 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
09:00 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
09:37 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:57 <Rajan\_Mistry> has joined #xwiki  
10:16 <vmassol> has quit  
10:17 <rrodriguez> has quit  
10:20 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <vmassol> has quit  
10:27 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:05 <vmassol> good mornin  
11:06 <vmassol> tmortagne: re CM.lookupComponent() do we have enough replies? Should I/we send another VOTE email about getInstance\*()?  
11:06 <vmassol> (I think we should make any change before RC1 is released,i.e. today!)  
11:07 <vmassol> (I can help to do the change)  
11:10 <Rajan\_Mistry> has quit  
11:10 <Rajan\_Mistry> has joined #xwiki  
11:16 <vmassol> vote sent  
11:16 <vmassol> just to be sure we all agree since it's an important api  
11:16 <vmassol> tmortagne, cjd, sdumitriu, AndreasJonsson, jvdrean, mflorea: please vote asap  
11:17 <vmassol> (I know we have a lot of votes these past few days ;-) but this is  a simple one)  
11:21 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:42 <+tmortagne> vmassol: ok  
11:43 <+tmortagne> as for RC1 why do you say today ? I see Apr 9 in jira calendar  
11:44 <vmassol> because 9th is Monday  
11:44 <+tmortagne> then it will be tuesday IMO not today  
11:44 <vmassol> the relase is monday morning  
11:44 <+tmortagne> especially since there hasn't been enought time since M2 has been released  
11:44 <vmassol> not tuesday  
11:44 <vmassol> OFC  
11:44 <vmassol> we can slip  
11:44 <vmassol> but I don't like to slip even before we know we need to slip  
11:44 <vmassol> :)  
11:45 <vmassol> well ATM  
11:45 <vmassol> there's is no other proposal re dates  
11:45 <vmassol> which means FTM it's still Monday  
11:45 <vmassol> now we can discuss this  
11:45 <+tmortagne> sending a mail then  
11:45 <vmassol> what are we missing?  
11:45 <vmassol> wait  
11:45 <vmassol> you need to explain why you'd like to skip  
11:45 <vmassol> slip  
11:45 <+tmortagne> sburjan` did not had time to test it I think for one  
11:46 <+tmortagne> IMOif we change component API we really need it to be change before final  
11:46 <vmassol> sburjan`: can you let us know your status and when you can test  
11:46 <vmassol> I'm not convinced we need to wait for Sorin to release  
11:46 <vmassol> tma  
11:46 <+tmortagne> I would like to finish with relative vs absolute URL for redirect to have this  changed in a major version  
11:46 <vmassol> tmortagne: the earliest the better it's already late  
11:46 <vmassol> as I said I can do it  
11:54 <vmassol> going for an early lunch… bbiab  
11:57 <jssolichin> has quit  
12:03 <+tmortagne> guys release vote on dev mailing list  
12:06 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
12:14 <Rajan\_Mistry> has left #xwiki  
12:56 <vmassol> anyone knows if it works if I put non absolute URLs in a blog post when that post is viewed externally in a reader?  
12:59 <mflorea> has quit  
13:45 <+tmortagne> vmassol: we put things like [[ReleaseNotes.ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise40M1]] so it should be ok yes  
13:45 <vmassol> tmortagne: I hope, I don't recall verifying....  
13:45 <vmassol> :)  
13:45 <vmassol> Im' pretty sure images don't work though  
13:46 <+tmortagne> I guess we are using a special URL factory since otherwise I don't see why page links would be absolutes  
13:46 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-6344  
13:46 <+tmortagne> or maybe we really send relative links and the rss client understand them properly  
13:46 <vmassol> since images don't work I don't know if links do...  
13:47 <+tmortagne> we generate relative links it seems  
13:47 <+tmortagne> see http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/GlobalBlogRss?xpage=plain  
13:48 <vmassol> absolute you mean?  
13:48 <+tmortagne> non  
13:48 <+tmortagne> no  
13:48 <vmassol> I see only absolute ones  
13:48 <+tmortagne> you see absolute for link to the post  
13:48 <+tmortagne> look at the content  
13:48 <+tmortagne> of the post  
13:48 <vmassol> ah yes  
13:49 <vmassol> so it's all bad :(  
13:49 <+tmortagne> don't know  
13:49 <vmassol> I need to find a RSS client  
13:49 <vmassol> been a long time….  
13:49 <+tmortagne> depend what's the RSS spec, it could resolve the relative link  
13:49 <vmassol> hmm the brwoser should be ok to test  
13:50 <vmassol> testing  
13:50 <+tmortagne> links are working well in http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/GlobalBlogRss?xpage=plain  
13:50 <+tmortagne> when viewing with FF  
13:50 <+tmortagne> but don't know if FF strictly follow RSS specs  
13:51 <vmassol> yeah I guess it depends if the rss reader resolve based on the blog post url for relative links  
13:51 <+tmortagne> yep  
13:52 <+tmortagne> vmassol: works well in google reader at least  
13:52 <+tmortagne> it resolve the link  
13:52 <vmassol> ok could you check a blog post with an image?  
13:52 <+tmortagne> trying to find one  
13:53 <vmassol> yeah not easy  
13:53 <+tmortagne> greader only display the extract  
13:53 <+tmortagne> so for example I don't have images for Feature Status - Jan 2012  
13:54 <vmassol> arf  
13:55 <+tmortagne> need to find a post with image in the extract or without any extract  
13:55 <+tmortagne> plus one which is recent enough to be relevant...  
13:56 <+tmortagne> I guess we'll have to create a new one  
13:56 <+tmortagne> something you want to tell the world with images ? :)  
13:56 <vmassol> :)  
13:56 <vmassol> no idea ATM  
13:57 <vmassol> some dilbert about wikis maybe  
13:57 <vmassol> ;)  
13:58 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:59 <+tmortagne> in any case it's working well for links so it should be the same for images  
14:00 <vmassol> well I had the problem when I created the issue  
14:00 <vmassol> but maybe it was my RSS client not supporting it  
14:00 <vmassol> I didn't give a lot of details  
14:00 <vmassol> I know which client I was using though  
14:00 <+tmortagne> you remember the RSS client ?  
14:00 <vmassol> netnewswire AFAIR  
14:01 <+tmortagne> in any case what you say in the issue is true: we don't generate absolute URLs for sure  
14:01 <vmassol> hey I still have the client on my machine  
14:01 <+tmortagne> but then we need to know what's RSS standard and who's right  
14:01 <vmassol> tryting it  
14:02 <+tmortagne> would not supprise me too much that greader support relative URL even if the RSS spec say that it's not supported  
14:02 <vmassol> hehe last time I used it was for XE 2.3.1 release :)  
14:02 <vmassol> 10 june 2010  
14:06 <vmassol> ok I hate that…. since I've modified some blog post pages that were in the wrong category  
14:06 <vmassol> their dates were changed  
14:06 <vmassol> and thus rss client show them as new blog posts  
14:06 <vmassol> :(  
14:06 <vmassol> ah no wait  
14:07 <vmassol> was looking at the wrong feed  
14:07 <vmassol> looks ok  
14:11 <vmassol> tmortagne: I have an image on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/preview/Main/FeatureSurveyResult201204 ;)  
14:11 <+tmortagne> in the extract too ?  
14:11 <vmassol> yep for now  
14:11 <+tmortagne> ok  
14:12 <vmassol> I couldn't find how to see the extract in my rss reader  
14:12 <vmassol> it only shows one line  
14:13 <+tmortagne> hmm actually looks like we only send onle line in http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/GlobalBlogRss?xpage=plain  
14:13 <+tmortagne> does not sounds very nice to me  
14:14 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: is it expected ?  
14:14 <vmassol> ah indeed that's why I don't see it  
14:14 <+tmortagne> so it's not even the full extract

15:08 <vmassol> :)

15:08 <vmassol> +            <exclude>org/xwiki/query/QueryManager</exclude>       
15:09 <+jvdrean> I didn't, actually I can remove QueryManager from the excludes

15:55 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: around ?  
15:55 <+sburjan> testing postgres migration, and itfails :(  
15:57 <+sburjan> what should I do ? should I re-open the postgres issue and add the stacktrace ?  
15:58 <mflorea> has quit  
15:59 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:59 <dj> has joined #xwiki  
15:59 <+sburjan> vmassol: ?  
16:00 <dj> is now known as <Guest50772>  
16:01 <vmassol> sburjan: when was it closed?  
16:01 <vmassol> (for what version)  
16:01 <vmassol> wait  
16:01 <vmassol> it's been released anyway  
16:01 <vmassol> so you should create a new version  
16:01 <+sburjan> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7564  
16:01 <vmassol> s/Verson/jira  
16:01 <vmassol> you can link it to this one  
16:02 <+sburjan> yes, but 3.5.1 isn't released yet, so we might fix it  
16:02 <+sburjan> if in the issue it states fixFor 3.5.1  
16:02 <vmassol> yeah ok  
16:02 <vmassol> you can reopen the released issue if it doesn't do anything  
16:02 <vmassol> sdumitriu should know better  
16:02 <djadmin> has quit  
16:02 <vmassol> what's important is that you report it  
16:03 <+sburjan> ok, re-opening the issue and adding informations + stacktrace  
16:06 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
16:06 <evalica> has quit  
16:08 <+sburjan> seems I am using Postgres version: 8.4, which isn't the latest. Installing the latest postgres since we only support that  
16:09 <vmassol> yep  
16:11 <+sburjan> I don't have in my repositories postgres 9.x .. only 8.. I guess I'll have to install manually  
16:11 <+sburjan> anyway, gonna reproduce it again, so we know it doesn't work on 8, maybe it won't work on 9 either  
16:13 <tmortagne> has quit  
16:14 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
16:22 <+sburjan> As already announced a few days ago, 9.0 is gone from Ubuntu 11.10, as it is still only a development version and not an LTS.

18:34 <+sburjan> vmassol: could you re-open XWIKI-7564 because I don't have enough credentials  
18:35 <+sburjan> or anybody else  
18:36 <+sburjan> adding now the details of Postgres failure  
18:36 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: this is for you

18:36 <+sburjan> thanks  
18:43 <+sburjan> done, thanks again vmassol  
18:43 <@sdumitriu> Good morning  
18:43 <@sdumitriu> Will look  
18:43 <vmassol> has quit  
18:43 <+sburjan> and while re're here, I think we still have a small issue with COlorTheme migration too  
18:44 <+sburjan> do we have an issue about these ?  
18:45 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
18:47 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Can you check one thing?  
18:47 <+sburjan> ofc  
18:48 <+sburjan> shoot  
18:48 <@sdumitriu> In the 3.5 snapshot, in WEB-INF/hibernate.cfg.xml, is the mapping file xwiki.hbm.xml, or xwiki.postgresql.hbm.xml ?  
18:52 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: in the postgres section (which is uncommented) I have 3 hibernate mapping files: xwiki.hbm.xml, feeds.hbm.xml and activitystream.hbm.xml  
18:52 <+sburjan> so the answer is xwiki.hbm.xml  
18:52 <@sdumitriu> Which is wrong  
18:52 <+sburjan> well... I don't know, I just tested  
18:52 <@sdumitriu> I fixed the values you get when building xwiki-enterprise with the postgres profile, but not the template  
18:53 <@sdumitriu> But look:  
18:53 <CIA-120> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* re8a4d64 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/e8a4d64dab1f2dfbce9fe70e24c0ca9166956f53 / xwiki-platform-tools/xwiki-platform-tool-configuration-resources/src/main/resources/hibernate.cfg.xml.vm : [misc] Updated hibernate configuration template with the proper mapping for postgresql - http://git.io/byyfHQ  
18:53 <@sdumitriu> :)  
18:53 <+sburjan> snap .. 3 hours of testing .. at least you found it fast  
18:53 <CIA-120> Sergiu Dumitriu stable-3.5.x \* r52eb4f1 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/52eb4f126f8a4826b1a02342e5a19554f83a8edf / xwiki-platform-tools/xwiki-platform-tool-configuration-resources/src/main/resources/hibernate.cfg.xml.vm : [misc] Updated hibernate configuration template with the proper mapping for postgresql ...  
18:53 <+sburjan> ok, so Monday I will test the migration on Postgres, ok ?  
18:54 <+sburjan> Oracle is ok, including attachments which can be downloaded properly  
18:54 <+sburjan> so only Postgres fail on the supported db's  
18:54 <@sdumitriu> You can try it quickly, just change to xwiki.postgresql.hbm.xml and see if it works  
18:55 <+sburjan> ok, doing  
18:55 <+sburjan> do I have to start with a vanilla 2.7.2 ? did the migration corrupted the db ?  
18:56 <@sdumitriu> No, it should work  
18:56 <@sdumitriu> If you just restart 3.5  
18:57 <+sburjan> no, I still got them
